constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 168, Number 38 (Wednesday, March 2, 2022)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Mr. McCLINTOCK:
H.R. 6903.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
Article IV, Section 3, Clause 2 (the Property Clause),
which confers on Congress the power to make all needful Rules
and Regulations respecting the property belonging to the
United States
[Page H1275]

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks, Forests, and Public Lands.

title: To require the Secretary of Agriculture to carry out activities to suppress wildfires, and for other purposes.
